item.title: Unit Testing Shell Scripts
item.description: Unit testing is great way to build confidence that your code works. Usually you’d write unit tests for libraries; but if you have a particularly long or complicated shell script, it might be worth converting it to a modulino just so you can write tests for it. And if you are writing a library in shell code, you need all the help you can get anyway. So let’s assume you have some shell code to test, now what?
